Job title: Technical Controller (Control Room Technical Operator/Maintenance Controller) (2 Posts)
Summary: About SPTStrathclyde Partnership for Transport (SPT) is the largest of Scotland’s seven regional transport partnerships. We run the Glasgow Subway, a host of specialist bus services and are responsible for delivering better public transport for all.The Subway has been modernised twice in its history with the previous modernisation taking place in the late 1970s.  We are currently undertaking a £288m transformational project which will result in the Subway being one of the most advanced systems in Europe.  This is your opportunity to be part of the future of Subway, helping us to deliver the first full Unattended Train Operation (UTO) system in the UK.As well as an excellent remuneration package, giving potential earnings of £40K to £44K gross inclusive of allowances, SPT offers a great career average pension scheme, free Subway travel and subsidised rail travel to and from work. About the RoleThe Technical Controller is a member of the Maintenance team reporting to the Shift Service Delivery Managers. You will provide first line technical inputs to the Operational Control Centre (OCC) as the primary contact for the Subway Operations team for any technical issues that arise during operational hours and co-ordinate the technical response to avoid or reduce any impact from service affecting failures.You will provide real time support to the Subway Operations team and ensure incident reports include all required technical details. You will be the first technical responder to alarms and diagnostic data outputs from the Subway Integrated System and initiate immediate action for priority alarms and co-ordinate appropriate technical responses for each event.The Technical Controller will play a key role in the monitoring and analysis of system technical data from the SCADA system and support the continuous improvement of the Subway Integrated System’s performance.This role may suit a maintenance technician/engineer looking to take the next steps in their career by using and growing their skillset, problem-solving, and technical expertise in a dynamic operational and data driven maintenance environment. About YouThe successful candidate will have experience of working in a maintenance environment, technical data analysis/use of SCADA and working on technical systems, including telecoms and control.   Knowledge of engineering methodologies such as condition-based monitoring (CBM) and reliability centred maintenance (RCM) is desirable.You will have experience of working in a safety critical or highly regulated environment and be aware of health and safety practices and requirements. Experience of a railway or public transport industry is desirable although not essential.You will be a Time Served Technical Apprentice or Graduate or be able to demonstrate equivalent experience.   An HNC in an engineering/technical/data science subject is desirable, although not essential.You will have the ability to work in an environment where a high level of concentration, vigilance and safety awareness is required. You must be able to interpret and explain technical information. You must be computer literate and able to adapt quickly to new technologies and software. Attention to detail and an aptitude to complete formal paperwork whilst recognising the importance of data quality and accurate reporting.A highly motivated, professional, reliable and capable individual you will be a team player with the ability to plan work, operate in a changing environment and react effectively to changing demands. You will use your good communication skills to collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to ensure our services are delivered in a professional manner and deliver positive change.Further details of the role and key responsibilities are set out in the job description.Please note, this position falls into the high risk category under the Alcohol and Drugs policy and therefore is subject to random & for-cause testing procedures.Full time hours will be 35 hours a week on a maximum 5/7 shift basis.   You will be based in Broomloan Depot, Robert Street, Glasgow. We are launching a new product portfolio that will become the foundation of all project delivery at Mott MacDonald:  A collaborative delivery platform that brings together project teams, partners and clients into one place to simplify and supercharge project delivery, delivering better outcomes for society across global infrastructure delivery.    This AIenabled platform will set us up for the next decade of transformative technology change. We aim to lead the industry with a highly ambitious vision. Initial pilots are live; now we seek a highly skilled and effective Principal Product Manager to confirm our strategy, accelerate progress and deliver impact at scale.  Are you ready to shape the future?   As a Principal Product Manager, you’ll be at the forefront of our digital transformation journey. Your role won’t just be about managing products; it’s about driving outcomes, creating impact and empowering change. You will lead the product management function in a 250strong team of product leads, product managers, developers, data scientists and designers—driving and owning our ways of working across the entire product management organisation globally.  What You’ll Focus On  - Drive strategic impact: Play a central role in developing our product management capability, aligning innovation with measurable outcomes. As part of a focused product leadership team, help steer the direction of digital products that support decarbonisation, resilience and efficiency across global projects. - Collaborate across sectors: Work closely with specialists in engineering, design, software development and data science. Your work will be shaped by diverse perspectives and deep domain expertise, ensuring our products are technically sound and meaningful to the people who use them. - Integrate AI thoughtfully: In our AI enabled ecosystem, embed intelligence into our products in ways that enhance user experience and commercial value. Focus on understanding customer needs and translating them into intuitive, data informed solutions that support sustainable outcomes.  Key Responsibilities  Product Strategy & Vision - Define and communicate a compelling product vision aligned with broader organisational goals and industry leadership ambitions. - Develop product roadmaps that balance customer needs, business objectives, and technical feasibility. - Incorporate feedback from customers and stakeholders into strategy and prioritisation.  Lead & Coach – Global Ways of Working - Drive our ways of working for the entire product management organisation—codifying frameworks for discovery, delivery and measurement. - Coach and support PMs, SPMs and PPMs globally to achieve their product goals, leading by example as the portfolio owner. - Embed lean, agile and modern product management practices and contribute to the continuous evolution of our product function.  Product Development & Execution - Lead end-to-end product development for the collaborative delivery platform portfolio, from concept to delivery and scaleup. - Collaborate with cross functional teams (engineering, design, domain experts, marketing) to ensure successful execution. - Monitor progress, manage risks and adapt plans to deliver highquality outcomes.  Market Research & Insights - Conduct market research to identify trends, customer pain points, and the competitive landscape. - Gather insights from customers, project teams, business development, and industry experts. - Use data driven analysis and experimentation to inform decisions and validate assumptions.  Stakeholder Management - Engage proactively with internal and external stakeholders, including clients and partners. - Understand their needs, pain points and business objectives, translating them into actionable product features and outcomes. - Communicate progress, decisions and tradeoffs clearly and credibly.  Product Lifecycle Management - Define metrics to measure product success and track performance across discovery, delivery and adoption. - Continuously improve based on user feedback, telemetry and market dynamics. - Make informed decisions about enhancements, updates and retirements to optimise value.  Business Acumen - Understand the B2B landscape, industry trends and competitive forces across the AEC sector. - Identify growth opportunities, partnerships, and areas for differentiation. - Balance shortterm revenue goals with longterm strategic vision and platform sustainability.  Data & AI Integration - Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to infuse AI capabilities (e.g., predictive analytics, intelligent assistance, automation) into the platform. - Ensure AI solutions align with customer needs, ethical standards, security and commercial value. - Strategically leverage data and AI insights without overengineering—creating innovative, usercentric and commercially viable products.  Candidate Specification: Formal Education & Experience - University degree in business, engineering or a related field. - Extensive product management experience (preferably B2B), including leadership of complex products or portfolios. - Track record of successful product launches, client satisfaction and influencing organisational practices.  Skills & Abilities - Strong leadership and communication skills; able to influence without direct authority. - Strategic thinker with a customercentric mindset and a bias for action—passionate and visionary, yet pragmatic and deliveryfocused. - Proven collaboration across functions and with senior stakeholders. - Adaptability in a dynamic business environment; comfortable with discovery, ambiguity and iteration.  Preferred Experience - B2B software, enterprise solutions or industrial sectors. - Partner management and ecosystem development. - Technical software background; knowledge of AI and data products desirable. - Experience shaping product operating models and ways of working at scale.  Success Metrics - Clear, validated strategy and accelerated delivery for the collaborative delivery platform portfolio. - Adoption, usage and measurable outcomes across global projects - Maturity and consistency of product management practices across all portfolios. - Positive feedback from PMs and stakeholders on coaching, frameworks and leadership.  Why Join Us - An opportunity to lead a high-performing product management organisation and change and industry.  - Industry leading platform (Moata) and an ambitious new portfolio at the centre of project delivery. - Experienced team around you with award-winning technology and deep domain expertise. - A chance to set the standard for modern product management in a mission driven, employee owned organisation.
